cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 165 miles SE of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across Cuba today, then turning north-northwest over the southeastern Gulf, skirting the west coast of Florida, and accelerating northeastward along the U.S. southeast and Mid-Atlantic coastline
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west coast of Florida near the Tampa Bay region

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and tropical-storm watches currently limited to portions of Cuba, the Florida Keys, Florida Bay, and the west coast of Florida from Englewood to the Aucilla River
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane warnings for the Cuban provinces of Cienfuegos and Matanzas; Tropical-storm warnings for parts of Cuba and the Florida Keys west of Craig Key to Dry Tortugas and Flamingo-Englewood, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys northward along the west coast of Florida, then coastal Georgia, South Carolina, North Carolina, and the Mid-Atlantic shoreline including Chesapeake Bay
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤3%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts possible as the system passes to the east
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected in Baltimore Harbor; minor coastal flooding possible with astronomical tides
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible late Thursday into early Friday, producing brief ponding on terminals and approach roads
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated short-lived tornadoes cannot be ruled out over the Delmarva Peninsula as outer rain bands move through; elevated seas on Chesapeake Bay may disrupt pilot transfers
